Breadth-First.Explanation: Divergent clue collection: broadly cataloguing visual details and planning cross-referencing.
Continued broad observation: identifying traffic signs, railway line, wooden building without a specific hypothesis.
Further inventory of elements and initial leads, still gathering broad clues before hypothesis.

Depth-First.Explanation: Focused verification of train sign design to distinguish countries.
Forming and assessing concise hypothesis about Alpine setting and signage.
Narrowing hypothesis to Bavarian Alps by cross-referencing mountain view and railway.
Testing candidate mountain ranges against the photographed view from the railway.
Verifying Garmisch-Partenkirchen as location using maps and street-view comparisons.
Confirming railway line and church position in Garmisch-Partenkirchen via street-view.
Refining with sun angle and shadow analysis to adjust viewpoint direction.
Revising perspective by aligning mountain peaks and shadow patterns.
Pinpointing exact viewpoint on Außerfernbahn line west of Schmiedestraße crossing.
Cross-referencing maps and street-view to confirm line orientation and architecture.
Verifying photo direction and landmark placement at Schmiedestraße crossing.
Final confirmation using shadow angles, mountain peaks, and railway orientation.
Confirming exact viewpoint via placement of railway, building, and church tower.

Breadth-Depth Switch.Explanation: Transition from broad clue gathering to targeted verification of the train sign design.
